tool.name: Summarize taxa
tool.description: and store results in a new table or appended to an existing mapping file
tool.command: summarize_taxa.py -i '$otu_table_fp' -o summarize_taxa -L' $level' #if str($mapping) != 'None': -m '$mapping' #end if --md_identifier $md_identifier '$md_as_string' '$absolute_abundance' #if str( $lower_percentage ) -l '$lower_percentage' #end if #if str( $upper_percentage) -u '$upper_percentage' #end if '$transposed_output' '$suppress_classic_table_output' '$suppress_biom_table_output'

param.name: mapping
param.label: Input metadata mapping (optional)
param.help: If supplied, then the taxon information will be added to this file. This option is useful for coloring PCoA plots by taxon abundance or to perform statistical tests of taxon/mapping associations (-m/--mapping)

param.name: md_as_string
param.label: Include metadata as string?
param.help: By default, metadata is included as list (--md_as_string)

param.name: absolute_abundance
param.label: Report absolute abundance?
param.help: By default, relative abundance is reported (--absolute_abundance)

param.name: lower_percentage
param.label: Percentage threshold to remove highly present OTU (optional)
param.help: If present, OTUs having higher absolute abundance are trimmed. To remove OTUs that make up more than 5% of the total dataset you would pass 0.05 (-l/--lower_percentage)

param.name: upper_percentage
param.label: Percentage threshold to remove lowly present OTU (optional)
param.help: If present, OTUs having lower absolute abundance are trimmed. To remove the OTUs that makes up less than 45% of the total dataset you would pass 0.45 (-u/--upper_percentage)

param.name: transposed_output
param.label: Transpose output?
param.help: If checked, the output will be written transposed from the regular output. This is helpful in cases when you want to use Site Painter to visualize your data (-t/--transposed_output)

param.name: suppress_classic_table_output
param.label: Suppress creation of the classic (TSV) format taxon table?
param.help: This option is ignored if a mapping file is present (--suppress_classic_table_output)

param.name: suppress_biom_table_output
param.label: Suppress creation of the BIOM-formatted taxon table?
param.help: This option is ignored if a mapping file is present (--suppress_biom_table_output)

data.name: L1_tab
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: L1 tab
data.filter: "1" in level and suppress_classic_table_output is False

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool provides summary information of the representation of taxonomic groups within each sample. It takes an OTU table that contains taxonomic information as input.
More information about this tool is available on `QIIME documentation <http://qiime.org/scripts/summarize_taxa.html>`_.
